item.title: Ruby/Haml: Conditionally/Optionally setting an attribute/class
item.description: One of the things that we want to do reasonably frequently is set an attribute (most often a class) on a HTML element depending on the value of a variable. I always forget how to do this in Haml so I thought I better write it down so I’ll remember next time! Let’s say we want to add a success class to a paragraph if the variable correct is true and not have any value if it’s false.
